name: storeship
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a ship used by the navy to carry supplies to other ships: The Admiral arrived at the fortress with three warships and two storeships from England. He destroyed nearly a hundred store-ships and other vessels.
More examplesFewer examplesThe First Fleet convoy consisted of two naval ships, six convict transports, and three storeships.She accompanied the final withdrawal of troopships and storeships from Harstad to British bases in June 1940. "Sovereign", a storeship of 362 tons, left England for Australia on 25 May, 1795.
